title.narrative: "Watoto Wetu, Tunu Yetu" Improved early learning for 3-5 year olds in Dodoma

description.narrative: CiC will improve access and quality of age appropriate ECD for 3-6 year olds in Dodoma. CiC’s proven and government endorsed PPE model will cascade to 223 schools in Chamwino and Kongwa districts (reaching 22,000 children), and subsequently through local govt. to all wards in the region (reaching total 72,000 children). Complementing this is an innovative early learning approach that bridges the gap in provision for 3-4 year olds from community-based early learning to primary schools.

activity-date.narrative: this project officially started on 15th October 2019 and is for 3 years

organisation.narrative: All enquiries regarding this project should come to the primary contact person initially

mailing-address.narrative: 2 St Josephs Avenue Derry/Londonderry BT48 6TH Northern Ireland

recipient-country.narrative: This project is implemented solely in Tanzania. Some budget costs are allocated to head office in relation to supporting the project in Tanzania.

sector.narrative: This Project is directly contributing to SDG target 4.2 "by 2030 ensure that all girls and boys have access to quality early childhood development, care and pre-primary education so that they are ready for primary education"
